result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Romeo J Perez in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Romeo J Perez.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Defendant has a felony case in Br. 40 which is scheduled for status.  Atty. Wentz requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. .
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Romeo J Perez in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz is requesting a status date, defendant has a felony matter and there is a possible global resolution.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Romeo J Perez in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
